required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Clinical Evaluation of LEft VEntricular Auto Threshold Algorithm (LEVEA)
clinical_study.official_title: Clinical Evaluation of LEft VEntricular Auto Threshold Algorithm

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of the LEVEA study is to assess the performances of a new automatic left ventricular auto threshold (LVAT) algorithm (In-Clinic LVAT algorithm) when used by physicians during in-hospital follow-up.

detailed_description.textblock:
"In-Clinic LVAT" feature is a non CE-marked feature designed to be activated by the physician during 2 hospital follow-ups:
- first visit: planned to be conducted 15 days maximum after inclusion
- second visit: planned to be conducted between 1 and 3 months after the first visit The evaluation consists in the comparison between the threshold value provided by the algorithm and the threshold value obtained manually by the physician.

primary_outcome.description: The success rate is defined as the equivalence between the value measured by the algorithm and the measure obtained manually by the physician on 5 identified pacing vectors during the visit among at least 231 LV tests.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Accurate "In-Clinic LVAT" Test Assessed by an Independent Reviewer
secondary_outcome.description: This endpoint is the number of accurate determination of the pacing threshold value provided by the algorithm feature and an independent reviewer, on all available LV pacing vectors at first visit. An independent reviewer assessed all LV pacing threshold values provided by the algorithm at M0 visit and in all tested configurations

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Successful of "In-Clinic LVAT" Test at M0 Visit
secondary_outcome.description: The success rate of "In-Clinic LVAT" feature for all available LV pacing vectors at first follow-up (M0 visit). The method of analysis is similar to the primary endpoint.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Successful "In-Clinic LVAT" Test at M1 Visit
secondary_outcome.description: The success rate of "In-Clinic LVAT" feature for all available LV pacing vectors at second follow-up . The method of analysis is similar to the primary endpoint

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Eligible Subjects to LVAT Feature
secondary_outcome.description: Identification of the number of subjects who were "eligible" to receive the feature at M0 or M1 visit
Reporting of SAEs, device deficiencies and any suspect behaviour of the algorithm.

arm_group.description: All subject prior to study enrollment has been implanted with a CRT-D device. During follow-ups, under the supervision of the physician, the algorithm embeded in the device is activated with a password. The feature is deactivated at the end of each follow-up.

intervention.description: Algorithm offers automatic threshold measurement of differents vectors of left ventricular stimulation.
intervention.other_name: Activation of an algorithm in CRT-D device

participant_flow.recruitment_details: Subjects have been included from Feb 16, 2017 to June 2, 2017.
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: All the 60 patients were assigned to the treatment arm.

group.title: "In-Clinic LVAT"
group.description: 60 patients were included in the single-arm study. The Left Ventricular auto threshold (LVAT) algorithm test was performed at the 2 study visits M0 and M1.

group.title: "In-Clinic LVAT"
group.description: Single-arm study design: all the 60 patients were assigned to the treatment arm.

category.title: Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander

outcome.title: Percentage of Successful"In-Clinic LVAT" Test
outcome.description: The success rate is defined as the equivalence between the value measured by the algorithm and the measure obtained manually by the physician on 5 identified pacing vectors during the visit among at least 231 LV tests.
outcome.population: Complete LV vector test: test was performed (not aborted or interrupted) and a threshold value is provided by the algorithm. Successful LV Vector Test: LV threshold value provided by the algorithm compared to the manual threshold is considered “Successful” if the difference is within ± 2 step

group.title: In-clinic LVAT
group.description: Patients assigned to the single-arm treatment LVAT. LVAT test performed at M0 and M1 visits.

measure.title: Percentage of Successful"In-Clinic LVAT" Test
measure.description: The success rate is defined as the equivalence between the value measured by the algorithm and the measure obtained manually by the physician on 5 identified pacing vectors during the visit among at least 231 LV tests.
measure.population: Complete LV vector test: test was performed (not aborted or interrupted) and a threshold value is provided by the algorithm. Successful LV Vector Test: LV threshold value provided by the algorithm compared to the manual threshold is considered “Successful” if the difference is within ± 2 step

outcome.title: Percentage of Accurate "In-Clinic LVAT" Test Assessed by an Independent Reviewer
outcome.description: This endpoint is the number of accurate determination of the pacing threshold value provided by the algorithm feature and an independent reviewer, on all available LV pacing vectors at first visit. An independent reviewer assessed all LV pacing threshold values provided by the algorithm at M0 visit and in all tested configurations
outcome.population: Completed LV Vector Test: test was performed (not aborted or interrupted) and a threshold value is provided by the algorithm. Accurate LV Vector Test: The LV threshold value provided by the algorithm compared to the reviewer assessment is considered accurate if the difference is within ± 1 step.

reported_events.desc: SAE and device deficiency were collected through the study duration and AE was collected at each study visit.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The only disclosure restriction on the PI is that the sponsor can review results communications prior to public release and can embargo communications regarding trial results for a period that is less than or equal to 60 days. The sponsor cannot require changes to the communication and cannot extend the embargo.
